author: Jeremy Wilson
title: Southampton look to solve centre-back crisis by signing former Barcelona and Juventus defender Martin Caceres
text:
Football Southampton look to solve centre-back crisis by signing former Barcelona and Juventus defender Martin Caceres Injury to Virgil van Dijk and Jose Fonte's departure have left the club short at the back Credit: EPA Jeremy Wilson , Deputy Football Correspondent 7 February 2017 • 11:16am 
S outhampton are today aiming to solve their centre-back crisis ahead of the League Cup final against Manchester United by signing the former Barcelona and Juventus defender Martin Caceres. 
The loss through injury of Virgil van Dijk and the January sale of Jose Fonte has left the club desperately short of options amid a sequence of six Premier League defeats in seven matches but the 29-year-old is in Southampton for talks and a medical. 
Caceres has not played this season after ending his five year spell at Juventus last summer but is vastly experienced and has been in squads that have won La Liga, five Serie A titles as well as the Champions League. He was largely a squad player at those clubs – and suffered with achilles tendon problems last year – but has won 68 international caps for Uruguay and was in the starting team that knocked England out of the 2014 World Cup. Caceres has won 68 caps for Uruguay Credit: Reuters 
W ith Van Dijk and Fonte gone, Southampton manager Claude Puel has been using Maya Yoshida and Jack Stephens at centre-back, as well as Florin Gardos. However, Stephens has only just broken into the first team and Gardos has just returned after being injured for the past two years. 
Caceres will not come cheap in terms of his wages but, as a free agent, can be signed outside of the transfer window for free on what is likely to be a short-term deal. He also had a trial at Crystal Palace but Sam Allardyce instead opted to take Mamadou Sakho on loan from Liverpool. Southampton did also look at Sakho but were more interested in a permanent deal and were not willing to pay a potential £20 million fee. Serdar Tasci was also a Saints target Credit: AFP/Getty Images 
T hey were also interested in taking Serdar Tasci on loan from Spartak Moscow but that fell through amid concern over his fitness. 
The main issue with Caceres is clearly his match fitness after being without a club since last summer but he does not turn 30 until April and Southampton will be hoping that he can play a part both in the League Cup final and the final run-in to the Premier League season.
